messages.message: `view-my-hub` has concurrency issue. It wants 4 conversations but got 8. (example run (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/10860/overview/a020950e-8d6e-4a91-9b11-e19c7b076790?roarHideRunsWithDiffGroupsAndTags=1))
@Weiming Wu are you planning on fixing these? If not, could we skip these tests?
Trying to fix them is a bit trickier than I expected... Conversations are created every test run but not projects, so I have to make projects be created on each test run as well

we saw a different cause of failure in this test run (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/10879/) on Xindi’s PR - conversations were correctly shown in the earlier test result (“displays projects and conversations”) but disappeared in the later test result (“supports searching in conversations page”)

i think that it’s possible for a different test run to delete all Converse projects while this test run is in progress

Previously, _all_ Converse projects were being deleted by other test suites, so this test also did the same (forces a reset to a blank canvas to then put My Hub projects to check), so it definitely is a potential issue still
i've seen view-my-hub fail due to this several times today
Maybe we shouldn't delete all converse projects... since we don't have good test isolation, "delete all" functions will break a lot of other tests
It looks like view-my-hub is the only test that's clearing all conversations now
(At least that's what I'm seeing by tracing the endpoint URL)

so I'll remove that and make it do what Jessica recommended in the PR:
• Create projects and conversations with a random suffix
• Add a before call to remove any projects and conversations older than 10 min

also, we can’t require that 4 conversations exist

since other tests could also be creating conversations as well, there could be more than 4
It checks that 4 conversations starting with "My Hub" exists, so we can make it search for "My Hub {suffix}" instead
Ok the fix is finally merged! You can now rebase and hope that your CI's pass :smiling_face_with_tear:
